links.title: Help
links.tooltip: PadoGrid GemFire Dashboards overview and help

panels.description: The main dashboard of PadoGrid GemFire Dashboards (PHD) that resembles the main dashboard of GemFire Management Center (HMC). PHD includes additional metrics that are not available in HMC and vice versa. PHD exposes a finer degree of individual metric details along with federated cluster views making it more suitable for monitoring production systems.

options.content:

panels.title: Main Dashboard

panels.description: $Cluster: Cluster up time determined by the oldest member
panels.title: Cluster Up Time

panels.description: $Cluster: Number of running data nodes in the cluster excluding locators
panels.title: Node Count (Servers)

panels.description: $Cluster: Number of entries per region in descending order. Displays up to top 15 regions.
panels.title: Regions: Entries

panels.description: $Cluster: Aggregated get() rate across the cluster.
panels.title: Reads per second

panels.description: $Cluster: Total number of entries in all regions including primary and backup
panels.title: Total Entries (Primary & Backup)

panels.description: $Cluster: Sum of put(), get(), destroy(), putAll(), and removeAll() calls completed.
panels.title: Partitioned Regions: Total Operations

panels.description: $Cluster: Free, used, and max heap. For sustained performance, used heap should be below 80% of max heap
panels.title: Heap: Used, Free, Max (Aggregate)

panels.description: $Cluster: Number of primary entries in partitioned regions.
panels.title: Partitioned Region Entries

panels.description: $Cluster: CPU of the member that has the higest CPU load
panels.title: Max System CPU Load (Aggregate)

panels.description: $Cluster: Number of highest entries in replicated and local regions.
panels.title: Other Region Entries
